title: The Questions Everyone Asks (And We Love to Answer)
subtitle: Everything you wanted to know about dental treatments - with clear answers directly from the experts

questions.question: What exactly does the first visit include? And how much does it cost?
questions.answer: The first visit includes a comprehensive consultation, thorough oral examination, X-rays as needed, and presentation of a personalized treatment plan. This is the most important visit because it determines your entire plan.

questions.question: Do you work with health insurance? How does it work with insurance?
questions.answer: Yes! We work with all major health insurance providers. Some treatments are partially or fully covered, and we'll help you find out in advance exactly what's covered and what's not.

questions.question: How long does it take to schedule an appointment? Are there available slots?
questions.answer: Usually you can schedule an appointment within two to three days. For emergencies and urgent cases, we always try to find an immediate solution - don't hesitate to call.

questions.question: How about anesthesia? Are there different options?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We have advanced local anesthesia without pain, anesthesia adapted for children, and also the option for general anesthesia in special cases. We'll adapt exactly what's most comfortable for you.

questions.question: Root canal treatment - does it really hurt like they say?
questions.answer: That was in the past... Today with our advanced technology and state-of-the-art anesthesia, root canal treatment usually doesn't hurt at all. Most patients are surprised how comfortable it is!

questions.question: Orthodontics - how long does it take and are there transparent options?
questions.answer: Depends on the case, usually 12-24 months. We have a variety of options including nearly invisible clear aligners and technologies that shorten treatment time.

questions.question: What's the difference between a regular filling and a crown? When do you need what?
questions.answer: A filling is suitable for small to medium holes, a crown for teeth with extensive damage or after root canal treatment. We'll choose exactly what's most suitable for your case.

questions.question: Implants - are they suitable for everyone? How does it work?
questions.answer: Implants are suitable for most people over 18 with healthy bone. It's the best solution for missing teeth - looks and feels like a natural tooth.

children.title: Questions About Children - What Every Parent Wants to Know

questions.question: From what age do you bring children for checkups? When is it best?
questions.answer: The ideal age is around two and a half years or after the first teeth erupt. An early visit helps the child get to know the dentist and build a positive experience.

questions.question: How do you prepare a child for the first visit? What not to do?
questions.answer: Talk about the visit positively, tell them they'll meet a nice doctor who helps keep teeth healthy. Avoid scary stories or frightening words like 'injection' or 'pain'.

questions.question: Can I be with my child in the treatment room?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We encourage parental presence, especially with young children. It helps the child feel safe. With older children, sometimes it's better for them to go in alone.

questions.question: What happens if the child runs away or doesn't cooperate?
questions.answer: We have lots of experience with this! We use gentle methods, lots of patience, and sometimes just start with getting acquainted and playing. Every child at their own pace.
